title: Valencian Marxist Front
text:
Valencian <a href="Marxism">Marxist</a> Front (), an underground <a href="Communism">communist</a> group in the <a href="Valencian%20Community">Valencian Community</a>, <a href="Spain">Spain</a>, founded in 1954 by youth active in <a href="Lo%20Rat%20Penat">Lo Rat Penat</a>. It disappeared in 1962, when its members joined either the <a href="Valencian%20Socialist%20Party">Valencian Socialist Party</a> or the <a href="Communist%20Party%20of%20Spain%20%28main%29">Communist Party of Spain</a> (later forming the <a href="Communist%20Party%20of%20the%20Valencian%20Country">Communist Party of the Valencian Country</a>).
FMV had a <a href="left-wing">left-wing</a> <a href="Nationalism">nationalist</a> line, promoting Valencian identity. Leading members included Francesc Codonyer and Enric Tàrrega.
